question:
Recently, the RBI launched Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) Scheme 2018-19 Series V subscriptions. Consider the following statements with respect to the Gold Bond Scheme?
  1. The bonds can be used as collateral for loans
  2. Capital gain arising out of redemption of sovereign gold bond is tax exempt
  3. While the minimum permissible investment is 1 gram of gold, maximum permissible investment is 500 grams
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Under the Sovereign Gold Bond Scheme, while the minimum permissible investment is 1 gram of gold, maximum limit of subscription of 4 kg for individuals, 4 kg for Hindu Undivided Family (HUF) and 20 kg for trusts and similar entities. The bonds can be used as collaterals for loans. Any capital gain arising out of redemption of sovereign gold bond is tax exempt.
